function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential leakage of viral aerosols due to inadequate sealing of chamber parts.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contamination of the experimental chamber by microorganisms due to inadequate filtration or backflow prevention.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to viral aerosols during chamber maintenance and operation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling of infectious viral samples in the laboratory.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to viral aerosols during experimental procedures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Improper disposal of viral samples and contaminated materials.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling and cultivation of bacteriophage ms2 and e. coli c3000 may pose a risk of accidental exposure and infection.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data on the effectiveness of uv air disinfection in preventing airborne transmission of viral aerosols such as sars coronavirus.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain relationship between relative humidity rh and uv inactivation rate of bacterial aerosols.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown uv susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols under varying relative humidity rh conditions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential airborne spread of new pathogens such as sars coronavirus and influenza virus.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data on uvgi inactivation of viral aerosols.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the effectiveness of uvgi on different airborne microorganisms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of germicidal sources in the built environment during the heating period.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential reactivation of pathogens during air transport after central disinfection.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of sars-cov-2, influenza a, and legionella pneumophila transmission through indoor air.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate air exchange leading to high indoor air contamination levels.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of various sources for heat and cold production may increase the risk of cross-contamination and the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Humidification of air using water vapor may create an environment conducive to the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of germicidal emitters or sources may lead to the production of harmful by-products or chemicals.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate humidity control in the built environment can promote the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in air conditioning operation can lead to poor indoor air quality and ventilation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate positioning of uv tubes for germicidal sources resulting in ineffective disinfection of ventilation ducts and flowing air.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate calculation of required power input for uv tubes leading to underperformance or excessive energy consumption.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of environmental impact in the selection of energy sources for germicidal treatment.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for optimal performance of the uv-c fluorescent source.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Inadequate design of the uv-c system leading to high operating costs.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of indoor air parameters for different seasons.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of air conditioning ducts with dust and mold due to environmental conditions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Electrical breakdowns caused by high humidity and condensation affecting fluorescent lamps.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient operation of uv-c system in the event of air flow stoppage.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on specific operating conditions for uv-c system efficiency.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited efficiency of conventional t8 fluorescent tubes in uv-c range.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence of uv-c system efficiency on air flow resistance and mechanical effects on lamps.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fluorescent lamp efficiency falling below 70% in uv-c range at low temperatures and airflow.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shortened life cycle of fluorescent lamps due to excessive switching cycles.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significant power consumption and economic costs associated with uv-c system.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Long-term operation of uv-c system without proper maintenance and regulation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate regulation of uv-c system power output.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to monitor uv-c system operating hours and power output.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation, air temperature, dust pollution, and reflective surface degradation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation and environmental factors.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential exposure to uv-c radiation for maintenance personnel or occupants if not properly shielded or turned off during maintenance.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of uv-c system leading to reduced disinfection effectiveness.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poorly designed uv-c system leading to uneven radiation distribution and ineffective disinfection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pathogens transmitted through the air","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variety of pathogens sensitive to uv-c radiation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence of inactivation rate on pathogen type and environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of uv-c radiation at disinfecting transported air in central air handling units","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ozone production as a by-product of uv-c radiation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
